intro: Ficus blancoi var. longigrandifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved fig tree, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its large, glossy, elongated leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by edible fig fruits. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-draining soil. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to care for in suitable conditions.
